modules.description: This module defines a box structure with integer coordinates and provides functions to access its edges (`x0`, `y0`, `x1`, `y1`) and construct it from corner values. It works directly with `Stb_truetype.box` values representing axis-aligned bounding boxes. Concrete use cases include defining glyph bounding boxes in font rendering pipelines.

This module provides direct access to horizontal metric data from TrueType fonts, specifically retrieving the advance width and left side bearing values for glyphs. It operates on the `Stb_truetype.hmetrics` type, which represents the horizontal metrics of a glyph in a TrueType font. These values are used to correctly position and render glyphs in text layout, such as computing the spacing between characters in a string.

This module provides access to vertical metric information for fonts, specifically extracting ascent, descent, and line gap values from font data. It operates on the `Stb_truetype.vmetrics` type, which represents font metrics in a low-level font rendering context. Concrete use cases include calculating text layout dimensions and aligning text vertically in graphical applications.

This module implements a buffer for handling raw byte data using Bigarray arrays, specifically for working with STB truetype font data. It provides operations to create, access, modify, and slice typed arrays, with a focus on efficient handling of binary data. Concrete use cases include reading and manipulating font files in memory for rendering text in graphics applications.

This module handles TrueType font rendering operations, including glyph metrics retrieval, bitmap generation, and font loading. It works with font, glyph, and buffer types to support concrete tasks like text layout calculation, glyph bitmap creation, and kerning adjustment. Use cases include rendering text in graphical applications and processing font data for display or further processing.
